pychell API reference¶

Data¶

class pychell.orbits.rvdata.MixedRVData¶

Bases: optimize.data.MixedData

classmethod from_radvel_file(fname, wavelengths=None)¶

Constructs a new RV data object from a standard radvel csv file.

Parameters

fname (str) – The full path to the file.

Returns

The MixedRVData set.

Return type

MixedRVData

get_vec(key, labels=None, sort=True)¶

Combines a certain vector from all labels into one array, and can then sort it according to time.

Parameters

  • key (str) – The key to get (t, rv, rverr)

  • labels (list) – A list of labels (dict keys).

Returns

The vector, sorted according to x.

Return type

np.ndarray

to_radvel_file(fname)¶

Creates a radvel input file from an instance.

Parameters

fname (str) – The full path and filename of the file to create. If the file exists, it is overwritten.

class pychell.orbits.rvdata.RVData(t, rv, rverr, instname=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: optimize.data.Data

Constructs a general dataset.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray) – The effective independent variable.

  • y (np.ndarray) – The effective dependent variable.

  • yerr (np.ndarray) – The intrinsic errorbars for y.

  • mask (np.ndarray) – An array defining good (=1) and bad (=0) data points, must have the same shape as y. Defaults to None (all good data).

  • label (str) – The label for this dataset.

pychell.orbits.rvdata.group_vis_nir(data, cut=1000)¶

Groups vis and nir data into two different dicts.

Parameters

  • data (MixedRVData) – The RV data.

  • cut (float, optional) – The cut between vis and nir in nm. Defaults to 1000 nm.

Returns

The vis data. MixedRVData: The nir data.

Return type

MixedRVData
